message:
I have a question, Is it best to mention your freelance work in your cv and consequently in an interview or you are better of without mentioning that ?
For I've met different interviewers and/or managers who reacted differently to that. so what do you think ?

data.message: ok what you can do best is that after mentioning your work experience you can write Sample of my latest work: and below you can list all your freelance projects :)

Mohamed Alaa,Mohammad Tayseer, The problem is not where to put i'm talking about the concept itself as some managers will consider your freelance project a great thing as it mean you work more, you gain experience and you are active outside the work environment. on the other side some managers "sadly" will use this against you if you can't stay late they will say because you work at home, if you can't come in weekends they will say that too. they might even think that if you reading any blog about any technology that you need it for your freelance work :) 
 I've met both of these types :) but I wanna know which one exist more :)
The last type of managers will try to make anything to blame you: Freelance work, Facebook, phone calls, conversations over lunch, etc.
